content:
Bergepolis
Bergepolis (Ancient Greek: Βεργέπολις) was a Greek town located in ancient Thrace, in the region between the river Nestos to the river Hebros. It was founded by colonists from Abdera.{"citetype": "book", "year": "2004", "chapter": "Thrace from Nestos to Hebros", "title": "An inventory of archaic and classical poleis", "location": "New York", "publisher": "[[Oxford University Press]]", "page": "877", "isbn": "0-19-814099-1", "author": "Mogens Herman Hansen & Thomas Heine Nielsen"} Bergepolis was an urban center dependent on Abdera. Bergepolis survived in the Roman times.{"citetype": "book", "year": "2004", "chapter": "Thrace from Nestos to Hebros", "title": "An inventory of archaic and classical poleis", "location": "New York", "publisher": "[[Oxford University Press]]", "page": "877", "isbn": "0-19-814099-1", "author": "Mogens Herman Hansen & Thomas Heine Nielsen"}
Its site is located 9 miles (14 km) southeast of modern Xanthi.[2][3]
